intro: Rhynchotheca spinosa var. diversifolia, commonly known as the spiny rhynchotheca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and palmate leaves with a hairy underside. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The varietal form, diversifolia, is distinguished by its variation in leaf shape and coloration compared to the typical species.
